description: Optical Recognition of Handwritten Digits dataset containing handwritten digit samples (0-9) from 43 people. Images were preprocessed from 32x32 bitmaps divided into 4x4 non-overlapping blocks, counting pixels in each block to generate 8x8 input matrices with integer values 0-16. This dimensionality reduction provides invariance to small distortions.
creator: E. Alpaydin, C. Kaynak (Bogazici University)

feature_descriptions.input1-input64: Integer values (0-16) representing the count of 'on' pixels in each 4x4 block of the original 32x32 image, arranged in an 8x8 grid

feature_scale: All features are integers in range 0-16
use_case: Optical character recognition (OCR) for handwritten digit recognition. Applications include postal code reading, bank check processing, form digitization, and automated document processing.
data_generation: Original images from preprinted forms scanned and processed using NIST preprocessing routines. 32x32 bitmaps divided into non-overlapping 4x4 blocks with pixel counting in each block.
ethical_considerations: Dataset represents handwritten digits from a specific population (30 training, 13 test contributors). Performance may vary for different handwriting styles or populations not represented in the original sample.
